definition: one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: It has that dry quality to it.
Statistics, dry as they may be, give a lot more information than stories.
sentences.chinese: 而乾巴巴的統計數字，卻能比故事給我們更多的信息。

sentences.english: As he slams the spade back into the base of the trough, she turns away on the dry sole of her foot.
sentences.chinese: 他把鐵鍬擲回溝底，她蹬着乾巴巴的腳掌，轉身走了。

sentences.english: The street was bone dry and glaring white.
sentences.chinese: 馬路上一個水點也沒有，乾巴巴的發着些白光。

definition: lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
